history.content: CS 194-26 will be offered in Fall 2021 !!!! See here: https://www2.eecs.berkeley.edu/Scheduling/CS/schedule-draft.html

children.subject: Thank you so much for your feedback :)

I took the class Sp20 and did well without 182 or 189. It's more project-based (I don't remember a midterm or final, but maybe that was because Covid?), so my impression was that those classes will help you understand the theory better, but are not strictly necessary. There were definitely times that I felt like I didn't fully understand the theory, but I was still able to apply the concepts in the projects. Overall I really enjoyed the class! I'm a very visual learner, so applying cs to images was fun for me. You should check out the course website if you haven't already: https://inst.eecs.berkeley.edu/~cs194-26/fa20/

Also took it fall 20, was pretty cool! I agree w/Anon Scale that you don't need the classes you mentioned but they could help you understand the theory better. The prereqs of knowing linear algebra and 61B-level programming are accurate. 

I think one thing I wanted to add was that 194-26 is a class about both computational photography and computer vision. Most of the projects are about computational photography and you'll do linear algebra stuff, similar to 184. The project 4 is more oriented towards computer vision and involves neural nets, and I think it was pretty doable having never worked with them before. So if you're worried about that part of things, it's not for the whole class. And you don't need instructor consent to sign up, it's like any other upper div.

history.content: So I've been wanting to take CS184 Computer graphics for a while now, but I've never had the chance to enroll and it looks like it won't be offered in the summer or fall. I just wanted to know if CS 194 is similar to 184 because I've heard that it uses a lot of topics from 184, but just from googling computer vision, it looks like a field that is more oriented towards Artificial Intelligence and Machine learning instead of graphics. Also, for anyone who has taken the class before, I wanted to hear your experiences from it. I've read that the class has pre-reqs of programming knowledge (of at least 61b level) and working knowledge of linear algebra. "Experience with neural networks (CS189) is a plus". How much material from CS182/CS188/CS189 is used? Although it doesn't state that those classes are necessarily required pre-reqs, I would assume that knowledge and material from those classes would be heavily used in a class like this. I'm in the middle of taking data100 so there's some machine learning in there. Would I be able to get by without taking cs182/188/189? I'd also like to hear about the computational photography side as well. Lastly, do you need any form of instructor consent to take the course?
history.subject: CS 194-26 Computer vision and Computational Photography
